text: Supposedly the game "don't take it personally, babe, it just ain't your story" is the spiritual successor of Digital. I think that's horse shit because Don't take it personal is a anime style game. Nothing like Digital.
author: Trollioli

text: Analogue: A Hate Story.  Also has a sequel, Hate Plus.
author: Blarce

text:
@Blarce
I saw this on steam the other day. It looks boring.
author: Trollioli

text:
I personally thought it was really enjoyable.  Good tragedy.  Also *Mute is great character.

*Hyun-ae's a bit dull though.
author: Blarce

text: +Trollioli It's a spiritual successor in the sense that these games were all made by the same person.  That's where the similarities end.  Don't take it personally, baby, it just ain't your story, is also a very well done VN but it's just not the same.  Same with Analogue.
author: LeonisBrafer

text:
@LeonisBrafer
Yeah I ended up finding the rest of them but I really didn't like them. I thought that the author could have did a much better job moving from 80s computing to the 90s. Shame really, I still listen to the sound track of this game.

author: Woolyjuggs

text: @earthboundkid1 the "game" isnt about action. in fact, it's a visual novel.  It's meant to tell a story, hence the "novel".  Digital seems to focus a lot on the premise of "discovery" than anything else.  But, if it's not for you, then it's not for you. To each his own.

author: Rob Lowe

text: @scarletspeed7 I just looked at which 8 secret of mana songs they were. How does he have 8 songs without including any of the really good ones (besides Angel's Fear.) Meridian Dance? Fond Memories? Eternal Recurrence? One of Them is Hope? Now Flightless Wings? Considering clearly SD likes the game, I'd almost be tempted to think we'd have one of these landing on a hundred...but not a thousand.

text: And I'm back. Time to keep going with the list. This is a great visual novel you can play for free, I linked to it in the description. As the creator herself says, it's "a computer mystery/romance set five minutes into the future of 1988." This theme is very good too.
